definition: decline (in value)/extent of a drop
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
width/roll/classifier for textiles or pictures
limit up, limit down/limit on daily price variation

sentences.english: Accordingly, it is argued that current price limits in China should be relaxed or exterminated.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我国应取消或放宽当前的涨跌幅限制。

sentences.english: It was the biggest one-day loss for the Nikkei since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 这是日经指数1987年以来最大单日跌幅。

sentences.english: That was the largest single-week decline in 31 years.
sentences.chinese: 这是31年来最大的单周跌幅。

sentences.english: Microsoft Corp. and Travelers Cos. were also dragging down the Dow.
sentences.chinese: 微软公司和旅行者集团跌幅居前。

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dipped more than 7 percent Thursday as panic sell-off dominated markets.
sentences.chinese: 道琼斯工业指数周四跌幅超过7%，引发恐慌性抛售。

sentences.english: The Crash was the greatest single-day loss that Wall Street had ever suffered in continuous trading up to that point.
sentences.chinese: 这次崩溃创下华尔街在连续交易中的单日最大跌幅。

sentences.english: Banks were again the biggest fallers in the region.
sentences.chinese: 银行股再次创下欧洲股市最大跌幅。

sentences.english: Mining stocks were the biggest fallers as metal prices declined.
sentences.chinese: 由于金属价格下跌，矿业股创下最大跌幅。

sentences.english: GM sales dropped 49%. Ford was down 40%.
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车销量下跌49%，福特跌幅为40%。

sentences.english: With my current 35% equity stake, the decline would be more like 14%.
sentences.chinese: 以我目前35%的持股比例计算，跌幅基本是14%。

sentences.english: But the correlation broke down last week, with oil falling harder than stocks.
sentences.chinese: 但上周油价跌幅超过了股市，打破了这种走势关联。

sentences.english: Cairn Energy and Tullow Oil of UK decline is more than 5%.
sentences.chinese: 英国凯恩能源和英国塔洛石油的跌幅也在5%以上。

sentences.english: Sales of new homes declined in May to a record low as a tax credit expired.
sentences.chinese: 由于税收信贷过期，5月新屋销售跌幅创历史新低。

sentences.english: We didn't imagine the largest one-day drop in the history of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 但我们没有预料到人类历史上单日最大跌幅。

sentences.english: Asian stock markets also tumbled, with India's Sensex sinking more than 5 percent.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市同样暴跌，印度孟买指数跌幅超过5%。

sentences.english: It was down as much as 454 points, or 5%, before rebounding.
sentences.chinese: 反弹前，日经指数已下跌454点，跌幅达5%。

definition: extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
to fall/to tumble
market close
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
(of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
large fall
to rise/to go up
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
rising trend/upward momentum (e.g. in prices)
degree of reduction (in prices, numbers etc)/decline/drop
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
(economics) to slump/steep fall (in value etc)
